alert.note: Alert for Dubois; Orange; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 1:02AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN DUBOIS...ORANGE AND NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES THROUGH 145 AM EDT... At 100 AM EDT, a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Bedford to 9 miles west of Petersburg. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph have been measured with this line. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jasper, Paoli, Huntingburg, Orleans, French Lick, Orangeville, Campbellsburg, West Baden Springs, Saltillo and Dubois. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
